functional.template: Complete environmental remediation to achieve site suitability for intended use. All remediation to be completed in accordance with approved Remediation Action Plan (RAP) and relevant EPA/NEPM guidelines. Achieve Site Audit Statement confirming site suitable for intended use.

variations.unknown: Commission Phase 1 (Preliminary Site Investigation) and Phase 2 (Detailed Site Investigation) to characterise contamination extent, pathways, and receptors. Develop Remediation Action Plan (RAP) based on findings. Complete remediation in accordance with approved RAP and relevant EPA/NEPM guidelines. Achieve Site Audit Statement confirming site suitable for intended use.
variations.low: Complete environmental remediation as per approved Remediation Action Plan (RAP) with validation sampling program to confirm remediation objectives achieved. All works in accordance with EPA/NEPM guidelines. Achieve validation report or Site Audit Statement as required confirming site suitable for intended use.
variations.medium: Engage NSW EPA-accredited Site Auditor. Complete remediation in accordance with approved Remediation Action Plan (RAP) with comprehensive validation sampling program. All works to EPA/NEPM guidelines. Achieve Site Audit Statement - Statement A confirming site suitable for intended use.
variations.high: Notify EPA and engage accredited Site Auditor from project commencement. Complete comprehensive remediation program in accordance with approved Remediation Action Plan (RAP) with extensive validation sampling. Achieve Site Audit Statement confirming site suitable for intended use. May require ongoing environmental management plan.
variations.significantly: Notify EPA and engage accredited Site Auditor from project commencement. Complete comprehensive remediation program in accordance with approved Remediation Action Plan (RAP) with extensive validation and monitoring. Engage specialist environmental consultants. Achieve Site Audit Statement confirming site suitable for intended use. Likely to require ongoing environmental management plan and long-term monitoring.

quality.template: All contaminated material to be transported by EPA-licensed transporters and disposed of at EPA-licensed facilities with full chain of custody documentation. Validation sampling to be conducted by NATA-accredited laboratory to appropriate limit of reporting (LOR) values. Site Audit Statement to be issued by NSW EPA-accredited Site Auditor. Maintain comprehensive records including daily logs, sampling data, disposal records, and validation results for future disclosure requirements. All works to comply with SafeWork NSW requirements for contaminated sites.

sustainability.template: Minimise environmental impact of remediation through on-site treatment where practical (reducing transport emissions), beneficial reuse of treated material, and responsible disposal of untreatable material. Consider in-situ treatment technologies to reduce excavation and transport. Implement dust, noise, and odour controls to protect neighbours and workers. Design remediation approach to minimise disturbance to site ecology where possible.

budget.template: Establish remediation budget to include: site investigation, Remediation Action Plan (RAP) preparation, remediation works, validation sampling, and Site Audit fees. Maintain {{contingency:25}}% contingency given potential for unforeseen contamination extent, complexity, or additional contaminants discovered during works. Budget to exclude costs associated with EPA-imposed requirements beyond current scope, third-party claims, and ongoing management if required.

program.template: Target Site Audit Statement or validation report based on investigation findings and remediation complexity. Typical phases: Phase 1/2 site investigation (2-4 months), RAP preparation and approval (1-2 months), Procurement (1 month), Remediation works (duration dependent on scope and methodology), Validation sampling (1-2 months), Site Audit review and statement (1-2 months). Note: Groundwater remediation or PFAS contamination may extend program significantly and require long-term monitoring.

risk.template: Key remediation risks include: contamination extent greater than anticipated, additional contaminants discovered (particularly PFAS), groundwater complexity, disposal facility capacity constraints, weather delays, and regulatory changes. Maintain comprehensive risk register with mitigation strategies. Allow appropriate contingency budget and program float. Consider phased remediation approach if risk profile is high. Maintain regular communication with EPA/regulator throughout investigation and remediation works.
